comment.author: 79037172@N04
comment._content: Which battalion of the Grenadiers?  And for that matter they number their companies rather than give them letters.  And I can't find him as a casulaty on the CWGC site.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Try 25203 Pte Llewellyn Jones of the Welsh Regiment, listed killed 13 April 1918?  Another alternative being that this is one of the two Pte Llewellyn Jones who served in the Grenadier Guards; 26910 or 26766; both of who appear to have survived the First World War.//

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: The list of UK Soldiers who died in the Great War shows his birthplace as Llanfairfechan, Caernarfonshire, Wales and place of enlistment as Ferndale (Glamorganshire?)
